data.title: Olathe Civic Theatre Association
data.meta_description: See, Audition for, and Get Involved in Live Theatre in the Kansas City Metro Area.
data.text:
OCTA’s 2017 Buddy Award Recipients Announced, Now With Video and Photo Links!

Thank you to all who attended the 2017 Buddy Awards celebration which was held Saturday, June 3, and to everyone who made the OCTA 2016-17 season one of the most successful in many years! In addition to our current casts, creative teams, subscribers, and volunteers,...

2017 Buddy Award Nominees Announced!

The annual Buddy Awards, an event hosted by Olathe Civic Theatre Association's Board of Directors, is OCTA’s chance to say “thank you” to the many actors, crews, designers, volunteers, ushers, musicians, donors, and season ticket holders who have been an integral part of our season’s...

Poor Relations – About the Playwright, Playwright’s Notes, Video

In case you don't already know the playwright of our current production Poor Relations, meet Robert Flaherty Hart and read his insightful comments about the show. ABOUT THE PLAYWRIGHT: Robert Flaherty Hart has acted professionally in All the Way, The Jefferson Bottles, Amadeus, Much Ado About Nothing,...

“Poor Relations” Publicity Photos

Posted at 09:33h in Press Photos by Ted Collins

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE MEDIA CONTACT: Charlotte Gilman 913-484-1651 | asgcroc@aol.com RESERVATIONS and TICKETS: olathetheatre.org or 913-782-2990 OLATHE, February 18, 2016: Olathe Civic Theatre Association continues its 2016-2017 season with Poor Relations directed by Tina Morrison, written by local playwright, Robert Flaherty Hart. This drama runs February 17 - March 5. Check out BroadwayWorld KC for...

Poor Relations Makes KC Area Debut at OCTA

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE Media Contact: Charlotte Gilman 913-484-1651 | asgcroc@aol.com Tickets: www.olathetheatre.org | Reservations: 913-782-2990 or tickets@olathetheatre.org Poor Relations Makes KC Area Debut at OCTA Original Drama by Local Playwright Explores Family Secrets and Forgiveness Olathe, KS (January 25, 2017) – A new year means new plays for Olathe...
